questions.title: Evaluate the line integral $$ \int_{C} (x^{2} - y + 3z) \, ds $$ where $C$ is the straignt line segment from $(0,0,0)$ to $(1,2,1)$.

Find the mass of the spring in the shape of the circular helix $$ \mathbf{r}(t)=\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}(\cos t\,\mathbf{i}+\sin t\,\mathbf{j}+t\,\mathbf{k}), \quad 0 \le t \le 6\pi, $$ if the density is $\rho(x,y,z)=1+z$.

Find the work done by the force field $$ \mathbf{F}(x,y,z)= -\frac{1}{2}x\,\mathbf{i}-\frac{1}{2}y\,\mathbf{j}+\frac{1}{4}\,\mathbf{k} $$ on a particle moving along the helix $$ \mathbf{r}(t)=\cos t\,\mathbf{i}+\sin t\,\mathbf{j}+t\,\mathbf{k}, $$ from $(1,0,0)$ to $(-1,0,3\pi)$.

Evaluate the line integral $$ \int_{C} \mathbf{F} \cdot d\mathbf{r}, $$ where $C$ is a piecewise smooth curve from $(-1,4)$ to $(1,2)$ and $$ \mathbf{F}(x,y)=2xy\,\mathbf{i} + (x^2 - y)\,\mathbf{j} $$ as shown in the figure.

Evaluate the line integral \(\int_{C} \mathbf{F} \cdot d\mathbf{r}\) where the curve \(C\) is a space curve from \((1,1,0)\) to \((0,2,3)\), and \(\mathbf{F}(x,y,z) = 2xy\,\mathbf{i} + (x^{2} + z^{2})\,\mathbf{j} + 2yz\,\mathbf{k}\). The curve is shown in the figure.
